data: `minecraft:behavior.jump_to_block` allows the mob to search around for a block to jump to and then jump to that block.

data.Name: cooldown_range
data.Description: Minimum and maximum cooldown time-range (positive, in seconds) between each attempted jump.

data.Name: forbidden_blocks
data.Description: Blocks that the mob can't jump to.

data.Name: max_velocity
data.Description: The maximum velocity with which the mob can jump.

data.Name: minimum_distance
data.Description: The minimum distance (in blocks) from the mob to a block, in order to consider jumping to it.

data.Name: minimum_path_length
data.Description: The minimum length (in blocks) of the mobs path to a block, in order to consider jumping to it.

data.Name: preferred_blocks
data.Description: Blocks that the mob prefers jumping to.

data.Name: preferred_blocks_chance
data.Description: Chance (between 0.0 and 1.0) that the mob will jump to a preferred block, if in range. Only matters if preferred blocks are defined.

data.Name: scale_factor
data.Description: The scalefactor of the bounding box of the mob while it is jumping.

data.Name: search_height
data.Description: The height (in blocks, in range [2, 15]) of the search box, centered around the mob.

data.Name: search_width
data.Description: The width (in blocks, in range [2, 15]) of the search box, centered around the mob.
